A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to background checks for child care providers, employees, and volunteers
Items.MatterName: Background checks for child care providers, employees, and volunteers.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to background checks for child care providers, employees, and volunteers
Items.MatterName: Background checks for child care providers, employees, and volunteers.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to allowing reusable beverage containers in sports venues
Items.MatterName: Allowing reusable beverage containers in sports venues.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York City Department of Education to develop curriculum on machine learning, and adapt their current curriculum and policies to account for the safe use of generative AI.
Items.MatterName: Department of Education to develop curriculum on machine learning, and adapt their current curriculum and policies to account for the safe use of generative AI.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to a study regarding the feasibility of providing parents with an annual $10,000 tuition reimbursement payment per student to cover the cost of nonpublic schooling and the repeal of this local law upon the expiration thereof
Items.MatterName: Study regarding the feasibility of providing parents with an annual $10,000 tuition reimbursement payment per student to cover the cost of nonpublic schooling and the repeal of this local law upon the expiration thereof.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, A.181/S.178, in relation to amending the New York State Constitution to remove the requirement that registration for purposes of voting be completed at least 10 days before election day.
Items.MatterName: Amending the New York State Constitution to remove the requirement that registration for purposes of voting be completed at least 10 days before election day. (A.181/S.178)

Items.Title: Resolution approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Expense Budget.
Items.MatterName: Approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Expense Budget.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to third-party delivery workers and powered bicycle safety
Items.MatterName: Third-party delivery workers and powered bicycle safety.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) and the Secretary of Homeland Security to grant humanitarian parole, of at least two years, to asylum seekers who entered the United States prior to the date this parole is announced.
Items.MatterName: United States Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) and the Secretary of Homeland Security to grant humanitarian parole, of at least two years, to asylum seekers who entered the United States prior to the date this parole is announced.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Assembly to pass A.4938-B and A.5310 and the Governor to sign A.4938-B/S.154-C and A.5310/S.157, which would set standards for lithium-ion batteries used in specific electric mobility devices and prohibit the sale of second-use lithium-ion batteries intended for use in a bicycle with electric assist, an electric scooter or a limited use motorcycle.
Items.MatterName: Set standards for lithium-ion batteries. (A.4938-B/A.5310/A.4938-B/S.154-C and A.5310/S.157)

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, A.1679/S.561, in relation to increasing the penalty for leaving the scene of an accident involving an e-scooter and further calling upon the New York State Legislature to include e-bikes in such legislation.
Items.MatterName: Increasing the penalty for leaving the scene of an accident involving an e-scooter and further calling upon the NYS Legislature to include e-bikes in such legislation. (A.1679/S.561)

Items.Title: Resolution calling on Congress to pass, and the President to sign, the Prescription Pricing for the People Act of 2023 and the Pharmacy Benefit Manager Transparency Act of 2023.
Items.MatterName: Prescription Pricing for the People Act of 2023 and the Pharmacy Benefit Manager Transparency Act of 2023.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the New York State Governor to sign, S.7587/A.7833, known as the “Commercial E-Bike Licensing Act,” which requires the registration of bicycles with electric assist used for commercial purposes and creates liability for employers for certain violations.
Items.MatterName: Commercial E-Bike Licensing Act. (S.7587/A.7833)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to adding two commissioners to the New York city taxi and limousine commission board
Items.MatterName: Adding two commissioners to the New York city taxi and limousine commission board.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to adding an investment roadmap to the streets master plan
Items.MatterName: Adding an investment roadmap to the streets master plan,

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation to support the provision of medication abortion on all college and university campuses in New York State.
Items.MatterName: Support the provision of medication abortion on all college and university campuses in New York State.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign, S.399A/A.338A, to enact the Safer Consumption Services Act, which provides for the establishment of overdose prevention centers.
Items.MatterName: Safer Consumption Services Act (S.399A/A.338A)

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, A.3903/S.5103, to amend the education law, in relation to including policies and procedures in school safety plans for responding to students having mental health crises in order to reduce the instances where schools resort to police intervention in mental health emergencies.
Items.MatterName: Including policies and procedures in school safety plans for responding to students having mental health crises in order to reduce the instances where schools resort to police intervention in mental health emergencies. (A.3903/S.5103)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, S.6733/A.7316, legislation that enables community health centers to be fully reimbursed for telehealth care services.
Items.MatterName: Enables community health centers to be fully reimbursed for telehealth care services. (S.6733/A.7316)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the designation of rapid emergency response centers in each community district
Items.MatterName: Designation of rapid emergency response centers in each community district.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reporting on the number of bedrooms created though inclusionary housing programs
Items.MatterName: Reporting on the number of bedrooms created though inclusionary housing programs.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on Congress to pass, and the President to sign, S.1488/H.R.3183, the “Enhance Access to SNAP Act of 2023” (EATS Act of 2023), to remove certain eligibility disqualifications that restrict otherwise eligible students from participating in the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program.
Items.MatterName: Enhance Access to SNAP Act of 2023 (EATS Act of 2023) (S.1488/H.R.3183)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to safety standards for powered bicycles and powered mobility devices used for food delivery services.
Items.MatterName: Safety standards for powered bicycles and powered mobility devices used for food delivery services.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of parks and recreation to resolve risks posed by trees on public property
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of parks and recreation to resolve risks posed by trees on public property.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to pass, and the President to sign, S. 1350/H.R 2964, the Wastewater Infrastructure Pollution Prevention and Environmental Safety Act (WIPPES), requiring the Federal Trade Commission to issue regulations requiring certain products to have “Do Not Flush” labeling.
Items.MatterName: Wastewater Infrastructure Pollution Prevention and Environmental Safety Act (WIPPES).  (S.1350/H.R 2964)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of education to report on certain physical facilities at city schools
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of education to report on certain physical facilities at city schools.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to an annual education campaign to combat antisemitism and promote inclusion
Items.MatterName: Annual education campaign to combat antisemitism and promote inclusion.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to ensuring emergency vehicle access to open streets
Items.MatterName: Ensuring emergency vehicle access to open streets.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to refusing to renew, suspending, or revoking a license of a tobacco retail dealer that has violated certain authorization requirements of the cannabis law
Items.MatterName: Refusing to renew, suspending, or revoking a license of a tobacco retail dealer that has violated certain authorization requirements of the cannabis law.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the New York city department of education to distribute New York state non-driver identification card applications to all high school students
Items.MatterName: Requiring the NYC department of education to distribute NY state non-driver identification card applications to all high school students.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation requiring city agencies to provide an “X” option for gender on certain forms.
Items.MatterName: Requiring city agencies to provide an “X” option for gender on certain forms.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, S.3004/A.6324, which would establish an Office of Older Adult Workforce Development within the State Office for the Aging.
Items.MatterName: Establish an Office of Older Adult Workforce Development within the State Office for the Aging. (S.3004/A.6324)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon institutions of higher education in New York City to take action to create and foster LGBTQIA+ inclusive campus climates.
Items.MatterName: Take action to create and foster LGBTQIA+ inclusive campus climates.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the Federal Communication Commission Management Agency to add alerts for missing persons with dementia to the Wireless Emergency Alerts system.
Items.MatterName: Federal Communication Commission Management Agency to add alerts for missing persons with dementia to the Wireless Emergency Alerts system.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, A.6362, to authorize localities to provide for an additional real property tax exemption for eligible persons who are 65 years of age and older.
Items.MatterName: Localities to provide for an additional real property tax exemption for eligible persons who are 65 years of age and older. (A. 6362)

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, S.884/A.6331, to direct the New York State Office for the Aging and the Empire State Development Corporation to expand encore entrepreneurship in New York State to empower individuals 50 years of age or older to establish small businesses.
Items.MatterName: NYS Office for the Aging and the Empire State Development Corporation to expand encore entrepreneurship in NYS to empower individuals 50 years of age or older to establish small businesses. (S.884/A.6331)

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, A.4375/S.351, to require school districts and charter schools to include instruction on the political, economic, and social contributions, and lifeways of lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer, intersex, and asexual people, in an appropriate place in the curriculum of middle school and high school students.
Items.MatterName: Require school districts and charter schools to include instruction on the political, economic, and social contributions, and lifeways of lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer, intersex, and asexual people. (A.4375/S.351)

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, S.6569-A, in relation to deed theft, and for the Governor to sign S.6577/A.6656, in relation to the theft of real property and protections for victims of real property theft.
Items.MatterName: S.6569-A, in relation to deed theft, and for the Governor to sign S.6577/A.6656, in relation to the theft of real property and protections for victims of real property theft.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, S.6352-A, in relation to certain housing accommodations and certain hardship provisions.
Items.MatterName: Certain housing accommodations and certain hardship provisions. (S.6352-A)

Items.Title: Resolution designating May 20 annually as Gloria “Hurricane G” Rodriguez Day in the City of New York and recognizing her contributions to the cultural landscape of her home borough of Brooklyn and to Hip Hop worldwide.
Items.MatterName: Designating May 20 annually as Gloria “Hurricane G” Rodriguez Day in the City of New York.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York City Department of Education to mandate training on generative artificial intelligence tools, including for potential classroom implementation, for all educators.
Items.MatterName: Department of Education to mandate training on generative artificial intelligence tools for all educators.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York City Department of Education to update its CS4All initiative to increase access to CS4All professional development for educators and administrators, particularly for those in underserved schools, and to increase training for all teachers.
Items.MatterName: Department of Education to update its CS4All initiative to increase access to CS4All professional development for educators and administrators, particularly for those in underserved schools, and to increase training for all teachers.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring third-party food delivery services and food service establishments to display sanitary inspection letter grades online
Items.MatterName: Requiring third-party food delivery services and food service establishments to display sanitary inspection letter grades online.

Items.MatterName: Establishing a screening program for endometriosis and polycystic ovarian syndrome.

Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of sanitation to install and fill dog waste bag dispensers on public litter baskets.

Items.MatterName: Menstrual products in city bathroom facilities.

Items.MatterName: NYS Environment Facilities Corporation to remove restrictive barriers and uncap funds NYC can receive for water infrastructure upgrades.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, S.1532/A.4576, to require school districts to establish policies and procedures regarding the treatment of transgender or gender non-conforming students.
Items.MatterName: School districts to establish policies and procedures regarding the treatment of transgender or gender non-conforming students. (S.1532/A.4576)

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, A.5007/S.2381, in relation to enabling constitutionally-qualified electors to register to vote and to cast a ballot on the same day at a polling location.
Items.MatterName: Enabling constitutionally-qualified electors to register to vote and to cast a ballot on the same day at a polling location. (A.5007/S.2381)

Items.MatterName: Penalties for improper collection or disposal of waste by mobile food vendors.

Items.MatterName: Sickle Cell Treatment Act. (S1839A/A2609 and S1890/A2661)

Items.MatterName: Installation of solar photovoltaic systems on city-owned property.

Items.MatterName: Rejecting sidewalk and roadway cafe licenses for food service establishments that violate labor laws.

Items.MatterName: Penalties in tax exempt projects due to source of income discrimination.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, S.5713/A.3249, to require the establishment of a composting program at dormitories, dining facilities, and other facilities owned, occupied, or operated by the State University of New York, the City University of New York, and institutions subject to their jurisdiction.
Items.MatterName: Establishment of a composting program at dormitories, dining facilities, and other facilities owned, occupied, or operated by the State University of New York, the City University of New York, and institutions subject to their jurisdiction. (S.5713/A.3249

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to requiring the department of cultural affairs to report annually on department funding of art and cultural organizations and institutions
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of cultural affairs to report annually on department funding of art and cultural organizations and institutions.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the Governor to sign S.5026/A.6040 enacting the “Freelance Isn’t Free Act” in New York State.
Items.MatterName: Freelance Isn’t Free Act (S.5026/A.6040)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to a report on staff misconduct at the department of correction
Items.MatterName: Report on staff misconduct at the department of correction.

Items.Title: Resolution expressing support of H. Res. 77, calling on the President to embrace the goals and provisions of the Treaty on the Prohibition of Nuclear Weapons and make nuclear disarmament the centerpiece of U.S. national security policy.
Items.MatterName: President to embrace the goals and provisions of the Treaty on the Prohibition of Nuclear Weapons and make nuclear disarmament the centerpiece of U.S. national security policy. (H.R. 77)

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States Congress to pass and the President to sign, H.R.4972-118th Congress, known as The End Solitary Confinement Act.
Items.MatterName: The End Solitary Confinement Act (H.R.4972)

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, S.5439/A.5914, to designate Xylazine as a Schedule III depressant.
Items.MatterName: Designate Xylazine as a Schedule III depressant. (S.5439/A.5914)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the license term for master electrician and special electrician licenses
Items.MatterName: License term for master electrician and special electrician licenses.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the requirement of food vendors to obtain a certificate of authority to collect sales tax
Items.MatterName: Requirement of food vendors to obtain a certificate of authority to collect sales tax.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Board of Elections to refrain from certifying and the New York City Board of Elections to refrain from purchasing: direct recording electronic voting machines; voting machines that encode votes cast on a paper ballot as barcodes or QR codes; and any voting machines that do not utilize or create individual, voter-verifiable paper ballots that are marked by the voter by hand or through the use of an accessible nontabulating ballot marking device.
Items.MatterName: NYS Board of Elections to refrain from certifying and the NYC Board of Elections to refrain from purchasing: direct recording electronic voting machines; voting machines that encode votes cast on a paper ballot as barcodes or QR codes.
